#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<stdlib.h>
#include<string.h>
#define fori(a) for(i=0;i<a;i++)
#define forj(a) for(j=0;j<a;j++)
#define fork(a,b) for(k=a;k<b;k++)
int readint()
{
    int t=0;
    char c;
    c=getchar();
    while(c<'0' || c>'9')
        c=getchar();
    while(c>='0' && c<='9')
    {
        t=(t<<3)+(t<<1)+c-'0';
        c=getchar();
    }
    return t;
}
int main()
{
    int i,j,k,t,l1,l2,l,p1,p2;
    t=readint();
    char m[200];
    gets(m);
    int power[26]= {0};
    l=strlen(m);
    fori(l)
    {
        power[(m[i]-(int)'a')]=i;
        //printf("%c %d\n",m[i],power[(m[i]-(int)'a')]);
    }
    char a[200],b[200];
    int counta[26]= {0},countb[26]= {0};
    fori(t)
    {
        char a[200],b[200];
        int counta[26]= {0},countb[26]= {0};
        gets(a);
        gets(b);
        l1=strlen(a);
        l2=strlen(b);
        forj(l1)
        {
            counta[(a[j]-97)]++;
        }
        forj(l2)
        {
            countb[(b[j]-97)]++;
        }
        forj(26)
        {
            if (counta[j]!=0&&countb[j]!=0)
            {
                if(counta[j]>=countb[j])
                {
                    counta[j]-=countb[j];
                    countb[j]=0;
                }
                else
                {
                    countb[j]-=counta[j];
                    counta[j]=0;
                }
            }
        }
        /*forj(26)
        {
            printf("%d %d\n",counta[j],countb[j]);
        }*/
        p1=0;
        p2=0;
        forj(26)
        {
            if (counta[j]) p1+=power[j];
            if (countb[j]) p2+=power[j];
            //printf("p1=%d p2=%d\n",p1,p2);
        }
        if (p1>p2) puts("ALICE");
        else if (p1<p2) puts("BOB");
        else puts("TIE");
    }
return 0;
}
